subject: Business
title: Route Optimization: The Traveling Salesman Problem
description: A quick win: understand Route Optimization: The Traveling Salesman Problem.

hook.text: A delivery truck has 25 stops. The number of possible routes is 15 septillion. Computers find the best one in seconds.

buildup.text: Route optimization finds the shortest or cheapest path through multiple delivery points.

discovery.text: UPS saved 10 million gallons of fuel per year by eliminating left turns. Small route tweaks have massive impact.

twist.text: Perfect optimization is mathematically impossible for large numbers of stops. Algorithms find 'good enough' fast.

climax.text: UPS's ORION system analyzes 250,000 routing options per driver per day, saving $300-400 million annually.

punchline.text: The shortest distance between 25 points is a math problem worth billions.

quiz.question: How did UPS save 10 million gallons of fuel per year?
options: By optimizing routes to eliminate unnecessary left turns
By reducing the number of delivery stops
